pr_title: Add Exclusive Mode to Group Layers Sample

timeline.message: add radio buttons to layer tree
format the layer names in the ui
add alerts and tidy up comments

timeline.body:
Maybe it's worth considering (two?) method(s) here?
`private void FeatureLayer(url URL)`
`private void addArcGISSceneLayer(url URL)`
I'll let you and @Rachael-E discuss whether that's applicable here.

replies.bodyText: I followed what we did in another sample adding this way, so will leave as is to be checked/discussed if needed 👍
replies.author: jenmerritt

replies.bodyText: happy with this as is, although the urls are going way over our line limit (around 110 chars) recommendation. adding a line break before the string part of each code line should get over that more or less.
replies.author: Rachael-E

timeline.body: Perhaps adding a `.loadAsync` above this line (and below when iterating over buildingsGroupLayer) would help with the wait happening when switching between the different group layers
timeline.bodyText: Perhaps adding a .loadAsync above this line (and below when iterating over buildingsGroupLayer) would help with the wait happening when switching between the different group layers
timeline.bodyHTML: Perhaps adding a .loadAsync above this line (and below when iterating over buildingsGroupLayer) would help with the wait happening when switching between the different group layers
timeline.author: JonLavi

replies.bodyText:
@JonLavi The last few days I've tested a load of strategies in terms of how the layers are loaded and also added to the UI (which is currently in the order at which the layers are loaded, rather than the order they are on the map) to see if/what improvements can be made.  @TADraeseke and I ran through it and compared with Android too. Conclusion has been that I've moved the loading out of this method (though the switch speed still seems to just be the layers themselves). I've also left the ordering pattern as it is for the UI.
I've saved the testing on a branch so if you or @Rachael-E  wanted me to share/discuss those just let me know.
replies.author: jenmerritt

timeline.body: There might be a possibility to use property binding here, but no need to spend too much time trying to optimise it if you find it's getting out of hand a bit.
timeline.bodyText: There might be a possibility to use property binding here, but no need to spend too much time trying to optimise it if you find it's getting out of hand a bit.

replies.bodyText: I had a look at this but couldn't figure out how I would do that. Could look at this together, or leave it if it's ok with the listeners.
replies.author: jenmerritt

replies.bodyText: Listeners might be the way forward actually, because it doesn't look like we can bind layer.isVisible
replies.author: JonLavi

timeline.message: move loading out of buildlayersview method

timeline.body:
I've re-reviewed this from the garbage collection perspective and we don't actually need these up here (I missed this the first time round!)

We don't need to worry about garbage collection since we add them to the scene's operational layers, and since the scene is attached to the sceneview, the sceneview can't be garbage collected.
timeline.bodyText:
I've re-reviewed this from the garbage collection perspective and we don't actually need these up here (I missed this the first time round!)
We don't need to worry about garbage collection since we add them to the scene's operational layers, and since the scene is attached to the sceneview, the sceneview can't be garbage collected.
timeline.bodyHTML:
I've re-reviewed this from the garbage collection perspective and we don't actually need these up here (I missed this the first time round!)

We don't need to worry about garbage collection since we add them to the scene's operational layers, and since the scene is attached to the sceneview, the sceneview can't be garbage collected.
timeline.author: Rachael-E

timeline.body:
the pattern for group layers is that they are "loaded" by default when they are brought into the map, so they don't need this additional load call.
```suggestion
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
the pattern for group layers is that they are "loaded" by default when they are brought into the map, so they don't need this additional load call.

Suggested change
// load the group layers
projectAreaGroupLayer.loadAsync();
buildingsGroupLayer.loadAsync();

timeline.body: from a workflow order perspective, let's move this up after the buildingsGroupsLayer set up, and before the layer is done loading to set the viewpoint camera.
timeline.bodyText: from a workflow order perspective, let's move this up after the buildingsGroupsLayer set up, and before the layer is done loading to set the viewpoint camera.
timeline.bodyHTML: from a workflow order perspective, let's move this up after the buildingsGroupsLayer set up, and before the layer is done loading to set the viewpoint camera.
timeline.author: Rachael-E

timeline.bodyHTML:
I think we can add the alert into buildLayersView where it's already looping through all the layers in the sample anyway and saves us repeating some code. If that doesn't work out, perhaps an additional method to save repeating the code?

Suggested change
if (layer.getLoadStatus() == LoadStatus.LOADED) {
// zoom to the extent of the project area group layer when the child layers are loaded
sceneView.setViewpointCamera(new Camera(projectAreaGroupLayer.getFullExtent().getCenter(), 700, 0, 60, 0));
} else new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR, "Layer failed to load:\n" + layer.getLoadError().getCause().getMessage()).show();
})
);
buildingsGroupLayer.getLayers().forEach(layer ->
layer.addDoneLoadingListener(() -> {
if (layer.getLoadStatus() != LoadStatus.LOADED) {
new Alert(Alert.AlertType.ERROR, "Layer failed to load:\n" + layer.getLoadError().getCause().getMessage()).show();
}
})
);
// zoom to the extent of the group layer when the child layers are loaded
projectAreaGroupLayer.getLayers().forEach(childLayer ->
childLayer.addDoneLoadingListener(() -> {
if (childLayer.getLoadStatus() == LoadStatus.LOADED) {
// zoom to the extent of the project area group layer when the child layers are loaded
sceneView.setViewpointCamera(new Camera(projectAreaGroupLayer.getFullExtent().getCenter(), 700, 0, 60, 0));
}
})
);
timeline.author: Rachael-E

replies.bodyText: Added this and tested and it works well 👍
replies.author: jenmerritt

timeline.body: reinstate the loadAsync after this line: as discussed with Gunther, for the current sample workflow this is required although it isn't best practice. We can update the design later.
